name: The Cottage in the Wood

reviews.text: We stayed for 7 nights at The Cottage and were not disappointed in any way. The warmth of the welcome from Mrs Pattin (the owner) was great, and we were helpfully escorted to our room in the Pinnacles, the modern annexe to the hotel which is about 100 yards from the main building. Our labrador was made specially welcome with her own doggy-paws rug, bonios and bowl (and most thoughtfully poo-bags provided!). The room was large (room 23) with what proved to be a marvellous view when the mists/snow cleared by day 5!!! The ground floor rooms in the Pinnacles all have small patios with table and chairs which would be lovely when the weather is good. The Vi-Spring 6 foot bed was superbly comfortable, the shower was really powerful and the bath large enough for a good long soak. The rooms are all individually designed, no "one size fits all" here. The little touches that make this hotel special were the provision of binoculars in each front-facing room, and an "emergency kit" of all the things one might have forgotten or suddenly need. Brilliant!
reviews.title: Outstanding for business or leisure: much more than the wonderful views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was excellent - prepared by the Pattin's son, who is a master chef in his own right - modern British with a twist, plenty of it and always very freshly cooked, served on very hot plates! We particularly loved the seafood which is fresh daily and brought up from Brixham I believe. The wine list is quite amazing, I have never seen such an extensive one (more than 500 wines) and it made a really informative read. John (Pattin) is a real connoisseur and his love of the subject as well as joie de vivre really comes through.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing weekend- despite the weather!

reviews.text: All members of the team, whether family or not, were very motivated, seemed to be very happy in their work, and nothing was too much trouble for anyone so it made it a real pleasure to stay there for a prolonged stay.
reviews.title: A trip to the Malvern Hills

reviews.title: Hotel with a view
Excellent short stay
reviews.text: We arrived at reception to be greeted by a very pleasant and efficient young man who showed us to our room after a speedy check in. I had requested a room with a view as it was our wedding anniversary and we got our wish, the view from the first floor room ( room 7) was stunning as was the room itself. The furniture was old fashioned but in keeping with the style of the room, everything you could possibly need was provided for us, including an emerging box of sewing bits and ladies essentials, bottled water and ample tea/coffee/hot chocolate. It really felt like a home from home. The bathroom was lovely with a huge bath and power shower, and gorgeous toiletries provided.everything was spotlessly clean. We ate at the hotel restaurant on the first night and very much enjoyed our meal, I had the hake with curried mussels - yum! And the hubby had the venison which went down very well, but the highlight of the meal was the soup starter OMG who knew that beet root soup could taste so good. Hubby followed with the large cheese board which he thought was a little overpriced at £11.95. Breakfast was ample, my only gripe would be that it would be nice to have the option of vegetarian sausage. The service by the restaurant staff was faultless. It's a shame the weather turned and we never saw the view after our initial glimpse, but the gesture was appreciated and we still enjoyed a fabulous weekend at cottage in the woods. We hope to return sometime.

Our room was on the top floor up two flights of stairs had a great view over the surrounding area. There were all the usual mod cons in the cosy yet spacious room with great attention to detail like the provision of a pair of binoculars to enjoy the views over the valley.

reviews.text: Very warm personal service and good food. Sunday lunch lacked the wow factor, not as great as other meals I have had there previously, which was a bit disappointing, but overall would go again for the pudding which was delicious!
reviews.title: Perfect winter break

reviews.text: 2 of us and our dog had a lovely 2 night last minute break at this hotel. If you like walking it is in the perfect location, on the hillside of the Malverns. Staff were very friendly there and it is a very relaxed atmosphere. Our room was lovely - very big and comfortable with a little patio area - the view was outstanding - overlooking the plain below. The footpaths of the Malvern Hills are footsteps away so really great for walks. We went into Malvern one evening and had a great night out there - it is about a 5mins drive. All in all a fantastic little hotel that we would love to return to (and have recommended to our friends!).
reviews.title: Outstanding quality and extremely helpful staff.

aka: The Cottage In The Wood Hotel
description: Stunningly set high above the Severn Plain with 30 mile views to the Cotwold Hills that form the horizon. Comfortable, friendly hotel with a reputation for consistently good food (two AA rosettes) and a 500 bin wine list. Direct access to the Malvern Hills. Close to Three Counties Showground. Family owned and run for two generations.
